job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Hampstead, NH
pros: shift differentials, significant time off, supportive and approachable management
cons: every other weekend schedule, can be stressful environment due to acuity

job_title: Direct Care Counselor in Hampstead, NH
pros:
Great place to learn about mental health, the mental health system, and provide hope and comfort to those in crisis.

Huge growing experience and filled with counselors who really understand the need for mental health. These counselors truly care about their patients.
cons:
Management does not all respect your education or experience.

There is a difference in how management is treated versus the Counselors that are interacting with the patients all day. Basically, there is a lack of unity between the management team and counselors. Counselors do not receive the support or respect from management necessary for a team atmosphere.

pros: Work environment is fun and challenging
cons: The amount of turnover can be stressful

job_title: Psychiatric Social Worker in Concord, NH
pros: Coworkers. Relaxed environment. Independence with role. Interesting work. Great starting salary for MSW.
cons: Management is focused on for profit rather than treatment. Inappropriate comments from environmental staff which often made me uncomfortable. Difficult to fire awful employees due to union. Sketchy workplace at times. High staff turnover and often low staffing.

pros: Co workers, free food, pay differential
cons: Management and the unsafe (at times) staffing ratio

pros: If you want a true work/home life balance, work here. You will NOT be bothered off the clock! Great benefits
cons: No EMR, could be very very successful

pros: Pay is high for a low paying field.
cons: Poor staffing, complete lack of training program, poor patient care, management who only cares about money.

review_title: opportunity to gain skills in mental health field
job_title: Mental Health Counselor in Hampstead, NH
pros: pay is well above what other similar organizations offer for direct care positions, numerous differentials for evening/overnight/weekends, team work amongst floor staff is second to none which makes acuity and stress that comes with inpatient psychiatric care manageable for the most part, free meals, 32 hours considered full time with option to pick up 8 hours for 40 hour week if desired, full time benefits allow for a generous amount of vacation time through earned time hours, work with patients challenging but rewarding, union affiliation and support
cons: private/for-profit which leads to decisions made by upper management to be based on business model outcomes at the sacrifice of quality patient care, obvious and sometimes hostile divide between unionized staff and management, inconsistent approval of earned time request from full time staff, no security for facility, very little room for career advancement, while union support is needed for hard working and dedicated staff who find themselves the target of petty personal agenda of some upper mgmt it also allows for the continued employment of individuals who have no business working in human services, certain upper management do not appreciate assertive staff in situations of advocating for patient care and safety for both patients and co-workers

pros: Great coworkers and staff who really care about the patients.
cons: It’s hard work and management is always asking staff to do more with less resources.

review_title: The benefits are good, the shift differentials are excellent. Pay is good..
pros: The differential are decent $1.75 for 3-11 shift, $5.50 for night shift, $3.00 for working weekends. Most of the staff are friendly, and this job is a good stepping stone for other experiences in mental health.
cons: Not much room for advancement. Although we have a union, not too many employees get involved. Also, their filing system is archaic, they refuse to participate with Electronic Filing, even though it's mandatory for hospitals to do this. They just choose to pay a fine each year.

job_title: Mental Health in East Hampstead, NH
pros: You controls what days and hours you want. The scheduling manager is wonderful. The kids (patients) are fun. The hospital will provide the needed tools to keep the patients safe. You feel appreciated.  Awesome differentials and great pay.
cons: I've heard many times, if your full time the managment treats you like crap. I've seen it too. No OT, they will run short if needed despite dangerous patients on the unit with barely any staff.

pros: Lots of earned time given, lots of different units so you can build your skill set quickly. Training for new employees is extensive. If you're a new grad this is a good place to learn a lot.
cons: If you're there a few years, you'll get to the top of the pay scale and there's nothing but cost of living increases from there. Nothing is given for merit, and there's little to no room for advancement.

pros: Above scale pay.  Opportunity to work with a wide variety of clients, with various challenges.  Atmosphere of teaching to increase knowledge vs. punitive measures for a lack of knowledge.
cons: Not much for tuition reimbursement.  Growth from position is limited.  Benefits are expensive.

review_title: Good learning experience for  weekend per diem Social Worker
pros: Able to conduct groups and assure regular weekly staff prepared for new clients every Monday morning
cons: Weekend position only, not a lot of interaction with Physicians or regular SW staff

pros: Professionally operated, in every aspect of  health-care . Very organized, clean , friendly co-worker's.
cons: Per-Diem  only. That's literally the only issue, I wish could change.

job_title: Substance Abuse Counselor in Hampstead, NH
pros: Great job good benifits free lunch
